thread.title: Antonio Morrison wins multiple awards for effort versus Ole Miss
thread.title_full: Antonio Morrison wins multiple awards for effort versus Ole Miss

title: Antonio Morrison wins multiple awards for effort versus Ole Miss
text:
Antonio Morrison wins multiple awards for effort versus Ole Miss FOX Sports 
Oct 5, 2015 at 5:34p ET + 
McElwain offers praise to his senior linebacker Mark Zerof / USA TODAY Sports FOX Sports  39p ET 
Florida linebacker Antonio Morrison was recognized as the SEC Defensive Player of the Week for his effort in the resounding 38-10 thumping of Ole Miss. Morrison also was named as the Walter Camp National Defensive Player of the Week. In the contest, Morrison accrued 16 tackles, including 3.5 for loss and 0.5 sacks. 16 tackles in their upset over Ole Miss. @GatorsFB ANTONIO MORRISON - Defensive POTW. #SECHonors pic.twitter.com/L8vEBRvEHA — SEC Sports (@SEC) October 5, 2015 
Morrison endured multiple knee surgeries in the offseason to get to this point. It was a question as to how effective he'd be post-injury. However, Morrison's leadership and steady play has been a welcomed sight for a young Gators ' defense. “I can’t say enough good stuff about this guy.” — Mac on Morrison “My hats off to that guy." — Scott Carter (@GatorsScott) October 5, 2015 
He leads the team with 40 total tackles, and is tied for second with 6.5 tackles for loss on the year. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters.
